intro: Cyrtococcum trigonum var. celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes star moss, is a rare and delicate epiphytic plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves that are often clustered in dense tufts. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically growing on trees or rocks in montane forests. Its foliage is usually green to reddish in color, depending on environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
